abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory. The project partially achieved its
            objectives of strengthening the structural base of the
            forestry sector and increasing the supply of industrial
            wood, and substantially achieved the objective of
            stabilizing soil conditions in parts of northern Nigeria.
            Sustainability is likely; Bank and Borrower performance are
            rated as generally satisfactory. Key lessons included the
            following: The Bank and the Borrower need to 1) ensure that
            a conducive policy environment exists or will be created
            within an agreed time frame before investing in forestry
            development; 2) identify and involve all project
            stakeholders from the planning stage and through the
            implementation and evaluation stages. A sense of ownership
            has to be created among the stakeholders to encourage a
            commitment to implementation and enhance project
            sustainability; 3) firmly establish from the beginning the
            collaboration among different agencies involved in the
            project; and 4) ensure that future projects, particularly
            for long gestation activities such as afforestation and
            forestry plantations, are designed as time slices of a long
            term commitment. This promotes a long-term perspective among
            the implementers and allows subsequent phases of a project
            to benefit from the experience of the previous ones.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project would support the efforts of
            the Federal and State Governments to: (1) strengthen the
            structural base of the forestry sector; (2) stabilize soil
            conditions in threatened areas and improve the supply of
            fuelwood, poles and fodder; as well as (3) increase the
            supply of industrial wood. The project would accomplish this
            with: (a) an afforestation program; (b) a forest management
            program; and (c) assistance for management, training, policy
            analysis, research and studies. The project's
            afforestation component would stabilize soil conditions and
            enhance soil moisture and nutrient content, benefitting
            agricultural productivity. The forest management component
            would improve the management of existing plantations and
            help establish new plantations, increasing the availability
            of industrial timber. The support for management, training,
            policy initiatives, research and studies would greatly
            strengthen the structural base of the sector.

abstracts.cdata!:
The project would support the efforts of
            the Federal and State Governments to:  (1) strengthen the
            structural base of the forestry sector; (2) stabilize soil
            conditions in threatened areas and improve the supply of
            fuelwood, poles and fodder; as well as (3) increase the
            supply of industrial wood.  The project would accomplish
            this with:  (a) an afforestation program; (b) a forest
            management program; and (c) assistance for management,
            training, policy analysis, research and studies.  The
            project's afforestation component would stabilize soil
            conditions and enhance soil moisture and nutrient content,
            benefitting agricultural productivity.  The forest
            management component would improve the management of
            existing plantations and help establish new plantations,
            increasing the availability of industrial timber. The
            support for management, training, policy initiatives,
            research and studies would greatly strengthen the structural
            base of the sector.
